text: 264049503 | BUMC | 63008698 | | 9104892 | 4/29/2004 12:00:00 AM | ischemic cardiomyopathy | | DIS | Admission Date: 4/29/2004 Report Status: Discharge Date: 3/1/2004 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** BRIGNOLO , CHUCK 321-31-20-4 Platnof Ave. , Chibroke Ri Ce Service: MED DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 6/26/05 AT 05:00 PM CONTINGENT UPON HO evaluation WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: ROURK , BRYON , M.D. DISPOSITION: Home DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: ECASA ( ASPIRIN ENTERIC COATED ) 325 MG PO QD ATENOLOL 50 MG PO BID Starting Today ( 5/3 ) GLYBURIDE 10 MG PO BID LEVOTHYROXINE SODIUM 75 MCG PO QD NITROGLYCERIN 1/150 ( 0.4 MG ) 1 TAB SL Q5MIN X 2 doses PRN Chest Pain HOLD IF: sbp less than 100 mmHg PLAVIX ( CLOPIDOGREL ) 75 MG PO QD LIPITOR ( ATORVASTATIN ) 80 MG PO QHS Starting Today ( 5/3 ) LASIX ( FUROSEMIDE ) 80 MG PO QD GLUCOPHAGE ( METFORMIN ) 500 MG PO BID BENICAR 20 MG PO QD DIET: Patient should measure weight daily DIET: Fluid restriction: 2 liters DIET: House / Low chol/low sat. fat DIET: 2 gram Sodium ACTIVITY: Walking as tolerated FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Dr Knickrehm on February , 2005 at Bipa Healthcare Center 051-469-9935 1:00p scheduled , Dr Gavilanes at Nysi Medical Center . You will be contacted with an appt in 2-3wks. 086-463-7490 , CHF program on Thurs November with Devin Apana at Sadeland Hospital 086-463-7490 2:30p scheduled , ALLERGY: Penicillins ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: CHF PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) ischemic cardiomyopathy OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay TYPE IV HYPERCHOLESTEROLEMI SMOKER FHX HTN s/p CABG CAD OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: Cardiac catherization w/stent for SVG to RPDA and LIMA to LAD OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) none BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: 48 M admitted via ED with 2 weeks of dyspnoea on exertion and 2 days of severe peripheral oedema. HCC : 48 N with CAD s/p CABG 1997 , Type II DM , hypercholesterolaemia , hypertension , EtOH use who presents with 2 weeks of progressive SOBOE associated with 2-3 days of severe peripheral oedema. Describes clear history of orthopnoea and PND. Denies chest pain , palpitations , light-headedness , syncope , fevers , chills , weight loss , malaise or other systemic upset. PMH : CAD , Diabetes , alcohol , CABG 1997 , hyperchol , htn. DH : ASA , atenolol 50 , benicar 20 , lipitor 20 , glyburide. FH : Nil of note SH : Smokes 1ppd , EtoH 6 beers/day O/E : Mildly SOB , T 97.9 , BP 147/105 , HR 108 , RR 24 , Sats 99% on room air. Facial plethora & dusky hue. No jaundice , pallor , clubbing , lymphadenopathy. JVP -> #obese# HS I + II + S3 with gallop. Occasional bibasal coarse crackles. Abdomen distended with shifting dullness & mild RUQ tenderness. 3+++ pitting oedema to knees bilaterally. Rash behind calves. LABS : BNP 1900 , TnI -ve , Hct 52 CXR : New cardiomegaly. No pulmonary oedema. ECG : Unchanged. TWI V4-V6. Nil acutely ischaemic. IMPRESSION : 1. New onset R > L dilated heart failure. Most likely due to ischemic dz and occlusion of grafts from previous cabg. Hospital Course: CV: Upon admission , pt's cardiac enzymes were cycled x 3 w/a troponin bump on second set which resolved by 3rd set. He r/o'd for hemochromatosis and multiple myeloma. W/u of pt's new-onset chf included an echo which showed global hypokinesis w/EF 20-25%. The pt then recieved cardiac catherization on 6/14 which was remarkable for 1.elevated L heart filling pressures at 29mmHg and PA sat fo 49% c/w Lheart failure; 2. LIMA to LAD patent , but 70-80% stenosis at distal anastomotic site; 3. diminished baseline flow of SVG to PDA s/p stent. Pt had transient ST elevation during cath , relieved w/ng. O/N pt had a couple episodes NSVT. Re-cathed on 5/29 as planned after diuresis for stenting of LIMA to LAD. There was one episode of NSVT one day following 2nd cath procedure. Pt remained in stable condition w/steady improvement qd. By d/c , pt's sob , orthopnea and pnd had resolved. Jvp was wnl , hepatic congestion resolved , abd no longer distended , LE swelling resolved. His dry d/c wt was 194.0 lb. Pt to f/u w/CHF program in 1 wk , cardiologist in 2-3wks and EP service in 6wks. Pt needs f/u echo b/4 his EF appt in October ENDO: Pt's blood sugars were well controlled during admission. Upon d/c , metformin was added to his home diabetic regimen. FEN: pt had a nutrition consult to review 2g sodium/2L fluid restriction diet PSYCH: Seen by the addiction team. Had no signs/symptoms of etoh withdrawal during admission. Declined antidepressants , nicotine patch but agreed to counseling as outpt. Pt encouraged to stop drinking and to quit smoking. CONDITION: stable DISPO: home w/close CHF program f/u. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: call md for chest pain , shortness of breath , temp over 100.4 or anything concerning DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: Echo in 4-6 wks before appt w/Dr Stith on 2/16/05 . No dictated summary ENTERED BY: RAVE , VINCE R. , M.D. , PH.D. ( ZA549 ) 5/14/04 @ 11:34 AM ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
